title: Excluded activities for privately-owned single-family detached dwelling units and townhouses
context: [ยง6E-42.2] Excluded activities for privately-owned single-family detached dwelling units and townhouses. (a) An application for a proposed project on an existing privately-owned single-family detached dwelling unit or townhouse shall be subject to the requirements of section 6E-42 only if the single-family detached dwelling unit or townhouse is over fifty years old and: (1) Is listed on the Hawaii or national register of historic places, or both; (2) Is nominated for inclusion on the Hawaii or national register of historic places, or both; or (3) Is located in a historic district. (b) For the purposes of this section: &ldquo;Dwelling unit&rdquo; means a building or portion thereof designed or used exclusively for residential occupancy and having all necessary facilities for permanent residency such as living, sleeping, cooking, eating, and sanitation. &ldquo;Single-family detached dwelling unit&rdquo; means an individual, freestanding, unattached dwelling unit, typically built on a lot larger than the structure itself, resulting in an area surrounding the dwelling. &ldquo;Townhouse&rdquo; has the same meaning as defined in section 502C-1. [L 2015, c 224, ยง2]
